articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Steve Holland, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Kamala Harris vowed a tougher approach to migration along the U.S. southern border and said she would not withhold weapons to Israel, in her first interview with a major news organization since becoming the Democratic nominee for president.
articles.title: Harris vows tougher approach on migration, supports weapons for Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian guided bomb attack on Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv hit a residential building and a playground, killing four people, including a child, and injuring at least 28 more, local authorities said.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv kills four, injures 28

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Israeli forces killed a local commander of the Islamist movement Hamas in the flashpoint city of Jenin on Friday as they pressed a major operation in the occupied West Bank for a third day, the Israeli military said.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill local Hamas commander in West Bank

articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: The investigation into Telegram boss Pavel Durov that has fired a warning shot to global tech titans was started by a small cybercrime unit within the Paris prosecutor's office, led by 38-year-old Johanna Brousse.
articles.title: Behind the arrest of Telegram boss, a small Paris cybercrime unit with big ambitions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: United Nations officials are preparing to launch a polio vaccination campaign in Gaza on Sunday that will rely on a series of limited pauses in fighting between Israeli forces and Hamas militants holding out in the besieged enclave.
articles.title: UN's Gaza polio vaccinations will rely on pauses in fighting

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: Typhoon Shanshan brought torrential rain across large parts of Japan on Friday, with warnings for flooding and landslides hundreds of miles from the storm's centre, as many transport services ground to a halt and factories closed.
articles.title: Typhoon Shanshan pounds Japan with torrential rains, severe wind

articles.author: Mayela Armas, Vivian Sequera
articles.description: Venezuela's capital Caracas and much of the rest of the country were without power early on Friday, the government said, blaming the blackout on sabotage by the opposition without providing any evidence.
articles.title: Venezuela's government blames 'sabotage' for power blackout

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The far-right Alternative for Germany is predicted to come first in at least one of two elections in eastern states on Sunday, piling pressure on Chancellor Olaf Scholz's federal coalition over the economy, immigration and support for Ukraine.
articles.title: Far-right AfD on track for its first win in eastern German state vote

articles.author: Asif Shahzad, Saleem Ahmad
articles.description: The start of operations at a Chinese-funded airport in Pakistan's Balochistan province has been pushed back for a security review after last week's deadly attacks by separatist militants in the area, government and aviation sources said.
articles.title: Militant attacks in Pakistan delay launch of China-backed airport, say sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy dismissed Ukraine's Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk on Friday, according to a presidential decree.
articles.title: Ukraine's air force commander dismissed after F-16 crash
